data.name: 0000 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Hey, pull yourself together, Kyon!

data.name: 0001 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Get on and carry it!

data.name: 0002 (402.ja) KYON_SIS (妹)
data.value: Get on and carry it~!

data.name: 0003 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Yeah, yeah.

data.name: 0004 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I had a bad feeling when I was ordered to bring the necessary materials from the…

data.name: 0005 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: …library to the clubroom, but I guess it's my role to get worked to death as a servant.

data.name: 0006 (402.ja) KYON_SIS (妹)
data.value: Look, Kyon, you've got to take these books as well.

data.name: 0007 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: You don't need to help, just sit over there and read a book or something.

data.name: 0008 (402.ja) KYON_SIS (妹)
data.value: Okayyy.

data.name: 0010 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I'm glad you responded so obediently, but I'm really not sure bringing you along was wise.

data.name: 0011 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: What are you doing, looking all dazed?! Carry these books and start reading them, quickly!

data.name: 0012 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Look--just how long do you think it's going to take to scan through all these books?

data.name: 0013 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Well that's why I'm telling you to hurry up, obviously.

data.name: 0014 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: If you can't read a book per minute, it'll be night by the time we start investigating!

data.name: 0015 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: There's obviously no way to read that fast.

data.name: 0016 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: What are you talking about? Yuki's already read three.

data.name: 0017 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: …Four now.

data.name: 0018 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Amazing, Yuki! That's inhuman speed!

data.name: 0019 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Kyon, you'd better learn from Yuki and try to beat her one book per minute record!

data.name: 0020 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Say what you want, but you're asking way too much.

data.name: 0021 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Anyway, we came here to investigate, right--not to speed read.

data.name: 0023 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Nagato, have you found anything that might prevent Haruhi from going to the music room?

data.name: 0024 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: I haven't found any data about musicians with a link to North High at the present.

data.name: 0025 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Hahh... I've got no choice but to read then, I guess.

data.name: 0026 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Just how long is it gonna take to defeat this mountain of books?

data.name: 0027 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: …Do you want to be able to read quickly?

data.name: 0028 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Hold on, you can make me able to?

data.name: 0029 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: …It's possible.

data.name: 0030 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: I'm surprised she agreed so easily.

data.name: 0031 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I'm not sure... Should I get Nagato to do something about it?

data.name: 0032 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Then, I guess I'll take whatever you're offering.

data.name: 0033 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: …Understood.

data.name: 0035 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: W-wait a second! You're not gonna bite me are you?

data.name: 0036 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: …Yes.

data.name: 0037 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Then I'll pass. If Haruhi sees, it'll only create misunderstandings I don't need right now.

data.name: 0039 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: …No, I'll pass.

data.name: 0040 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: Then, here.

data.name: 0041 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: What's this book?

data.name: 0042 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: A speed reading book.

data.name: 0043 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: "#P05The Super Speed Reading Textbook#P00," huh… I feel like just reading this is enough effort.

data.name: 0045 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Done! One book down!

data.name: 0046 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Oi, are you sure you're reading these properly?

data.name: 0047 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: I could read it just like that with a subliminal reading technique.

data.name: 0048 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: What on earth is that? A speed reading technique?

data.name: 0049 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: A speed reading technique I just came up with.

data.name: 0050 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Oh, it was just something you made up…

data.name: 0051 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: You visualize the text and burn it into your mind. You should learn to do it as well.

data.name: 0052 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Even if she has come up with some new reading technique...

data.name: 0053 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: ...she definitely hasn't considered how much practice it'll take to learn.

data.name: 0054 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: I see, I see…

data.name: 0055 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: This is deeply interesting.

data.name: 0056 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: It seems her impromptu speed reading was hopeless, so she's reading seriously now…

data.name: 0057 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: If you could just be quiet, that'd be great.

data.name: 0058 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: You read this before, right Yuki?

data.name: 0059 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: …I've completed it.

data.name: 0060 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: What do you think about the musician in this book, Yuki?

data.name: 0061 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: They're a fictional character, their actions are fabrications.

data.name: 0062 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Hmm. I think it's based on a real person's experiences.

data.name: 0063 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: I cannot confirm any existance of the pro- tagonist nor remaining characters in history.

data.name: 0064 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: Nor can I confirm the fictitious town of which the book is set.

data.name: 0065 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Huhh, is that so…

data.name: 0066 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Now just accept that, feel relieved and put an end to this training camp.

data.name: 0067 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I'll sneak in a chat with Nagato while Haruhi's thinking hard about that.

data.name: 0069 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Nagato, is it true what you just said?

data.name: 0070 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: I checked the author, characters, locations and more against the data in my possession.

data.name: 0071 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I guess it's unmistakably real then.

data.name: 0072 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: …Surely this book isn't something Haruhi wished for, right?

data.name: 0073 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: This book was here previously.

data.name: 0074 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Really?

data.name: 0075 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: Haruhi Suzumiya merely picked this book by chance.

data.name: 0076 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Hold on though, wasn't it you that read it first, Nagato?

data.name: 0077 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: I returned it to this pile of books after I read it.

data.name: 0078 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: So she picked it randomly from this pile? Unintentionally?

data.name: 0079 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: The chance of picking this book is not low. It's one in however many books in the pile.

data.name: 0080 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Then, what does she think is so interesting about it?

data.name: 0081 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: The fact that the book contains everything Haruhi Suzumiya imagined…

data.name: 0082 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: …and by chance she happened to pick it.

data.name: 0083 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I don't really get it--So Haruhi picked the very book that would get her excited?

data.name: 0084 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Is that what you mean, Nagato?

data.name: 0085 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: What's the chance of that?

data.name: 0086 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: Out of all published books, it would have to end up in the school library.

data.name: 0087 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: The chance slims further when you consider it has to be related to music…

data.name: 0088 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Sorry, Nagato... my head's starting to hurt.

data.name: 0089 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: …Here.

data.name: 0090 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: What's this note?

data.name: 0091 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: I wrote down the probability.

data.name: 0092 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: A "#P05note with the probability#P00," huh? I'll take a look later.

data.name: 0093 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I don't know if there's any meaning to this astronomical value, but I suppose I asked.

data.name: 0094 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I'll gladly take it.

data.name: 0095 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: So Nagato, what about...

data.name: 0096 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: What?

data.name: 0097 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: I was gonna ask the probability, but I don't get that complicated stuff, so don't bother.

data.name: 0098 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: …Okay.

data.name: 0099 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Sorry, Nagato.

data.name: 0101 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: What are you two talking about?

data.name: 0102 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Oh, I was just analysing this book with Nagato.

data.name: 0103 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: By the way, I thought about as I kept reading.

data.name: 0104 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I have a bad feeling about where this is going.

data.name: 0105 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: I think the town really does exist.

data.name: 0106 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: This town in the book was definitely modelled after it.

data.name: 0108 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Nagato is looking at her like she said something baseless.

data.name: 0109 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: What sort of story is it, Haruhi?

data.name: 0110 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: There's this musician, and whenever they per- form one of their pieces, it serves as a key.

data.name: 0111 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: …And?

data.name: 0112 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Whenever they play it, they're transported to a different time period.

data.name: 0113 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: …Isn't that just your standard sci-fi novel…?

data.name: 0114 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I don't see how that could possibly have characters or locations modeled on reality?

data.name: 0115 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: It's definitely a true story!

data.name: 0116 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Look, it's science fiction--even Nagato said it was fiction, right?

data.name: 0117 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: There's no way--! The town it's set in has the exact same feeling as this one.

data.name: 0118 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Wait, wasn't that book written a long time ago, anyway?

data.name: 0119 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Kyon, your imagination is seriously lacking--!

data.name: 0120 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I'm certainly not as much of a dreamer as Haruhi.

data.name: 0121 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: You listening? When this musician performs, they go to a different time period, okay?

data.name: 0122 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Even if it was written way in the past, they might be able to see the world as it is now!

data.name: 0123 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: There's just no way that's possible. Don't you think that's too far-fetched?

data.name: 0124 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Okay, then where's the evidence I'm wrong?

data.name: 0125 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: She's like a stubborn elementary schooler pressing you on every detail.

data.name: 0126 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I felt like I saw a glimpse of that when she made that duck face.

data.name: 0127 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Nagato--say something.

data.name: 0128 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: The author is from the United States of America. Sources say they never went abroad.

data.name: 0129 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: The author specializes in time travel stories, with most of his works having that theme.

data.name: 0130 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: …There you go.

data.name: 0131 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Oh, that's right! I get it!

data.name: 0132 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: You accepted it?

data.name: 0133 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: The time traveling composer must've traveled to America and gotten close with the author!

data.name: 0134 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I really wanna push her on how on earth those events would come to pass.

data.name: 0135 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: The composer told the author about their experiences so they could write the book!

data.name: 0136 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: What do you say to that, Nagato?

data.name: 0137 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: …The possibility is not zero.

data.name: 0138 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Hey, what are you doing agreeing with her?

data.name: 0139 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: That's gotta be it! The musician is surely traveling through time even now!

data.name: 0140 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: And every once in a while, they play the piano in the music room!

data.name: 0141 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Hey now…

data.name: 0142 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: It might not be a ghost, but this is unmistakably a supernatural phenomenon!!

data.name: 0143 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Good grief--even though we have all the evidence to prove that story is made up...

data.name: 0144 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: ...Haruhi blows it up into some crazy development.

data.name: 0145 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: If you think about it like that, it's not weird to hear the piano in the music room at weird times.

data.name: 0146 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: It's a lot more convincing than anything you could say about ghosts!

data.name: 0147 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I'd like to know how this is supposed to be convincing, because I don't see it...

data.name: 0148 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: It has way more reality than nonsensical ghosts!

data.name: 0149 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: The most nonsensical thing is you yourself, Haruhi--you should hurry up and realize.

data.name: 0150 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: What do you think, Kyon?

data.name: 0151 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: I don't think anything--it's just plain old fiction, right?

data.name: 0152 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: No--it's written so realistically, like they saw it with their own eyes.

data.name: 0153 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Well obviously, making it feel that way is a writer's job.

data.name: 0154 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I can't get my jaw off the floor after Haruhi's insane plot twist, but…

data.name: 0155 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: …I'm gonna thoroughly deny it in hopes it'll prevent her from going to the music room.

data.name: 0156 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: So, what happened to the composer?

data.name: 0157 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: In the story, the composer travels to a land they assume is heaven.

data.name: 0158 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: You would conjecture that the composer died.

data.name: 0159 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: See, if you assume this story is true, the composer died a long time ago.

data.name: 0160 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Therefore the story has nothing to do with the music room mystery.

data.name: 0161 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: They might be trying to make you think they died, but really they're alive in another period.

data.name: 0162 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: For what reason?

data.name: 0163 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: They must've found some secret when they were traveling...

data.name: 0164 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: …They had to pretend they were dead because an agency was chasing them!

data.name: 0165 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: What on earth is this agency?

data.name: 0166 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: They might be living a quiet life in the neighborhood--!

data.name: 0167 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: A quiet life...? Look...

data.name: 0168 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: The biggest mystery is how she comes up with this stuff.

data.name: 0169 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: She read the same book as Nagato, but got a totally different interpretation…

data.name: 0170 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: It's great that you're so imaginative, but let's be realistic, okay?

data.name: 0171 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: What do you mean, "realistic"?

data.name: 0172 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: In the first place, I have my reservations about the computer society's claims.

data.name: 0173 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: They've been doing all nighters, so they must've been half asleep or hallucinating...

data.name: 0174 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: You're the one that's half asleep, aren't you?

data.name: 0175 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: That's a harsh way of putting it.

data.name: 0176 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Anyway, the last phenomenon was just a mistake from the Computer Society as well.

data.name: 0177 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Why are you being so stubborn about it?!

data.name: 0178 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: There's no evidence of any phenomena, so what's the point of having a training camp?

data.name: 0179 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Listen here, Kyon--the point is to find that evidence, obviously?!

data.name: 0180 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: I think as healthy high school students, we should end this training camp…

data.name: 0181 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: …and go straight home to spend the rest of the summer vacation in a meaningful way!

data.name: 0182 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Haahhh. You're lacking all those wonderful functions given to us humans...

data.name: 0183 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: ...like creativity and ambition.

data.name: 0184 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Hey, that's a pretty horrible thing to say...

data.name: 0185 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Even Nagato is only saying what's realistic and accurate.

data.name: 0187 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Exactly--Yuki is realistic, and you're lacking in creativity.

data.name: 0188 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I don't really get the difference, but I guess I might as well ask?

data.name: 0189 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Do you get what she means, Nagato?

data.name: 0190 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: It's appropriate to explain it as her telling you to imagine things.

data.name: 0191 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Is that a "#P05hintP00"?

data.name: 0192 (402.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: Yes.

data.name: 0193 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Thanks, Nagato--not that I have a clue what you're saying.

data.name: 0194 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: I don't get what you mean?

data.name: 0195 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Yuki analyzed it, and you denied it without any kind of analysis, right?

data.name: 0196 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Guh... I've got nothing to respond to that with. I haven't even read the book.

data.name: 0197 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: That's why I'm saying you have no creativity.

data.name: 0198 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: I don't get why denying without analyzing means I have no creativity?

data.name: 0199 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Because I said so.

data.name: 0200 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: What a ridiculous "#P05theory#P00," huh.

data.name: 0201 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Anyway!

data.name: 0202 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: You're a young man without any hopes or dreams, Kyon.

data.name: 0203 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Saying I don't have any creativity is one thing, but don't just decide I don't have hopes.

data.name: 0204 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Coming here to investigate and only finding out that Kyon has no creativity...

data.name: 0205 (402.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: ...hahh... I'm worried about the future.

data.name: 0206 (402.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: That thing about being worried about the future? Yeah, right back at you.

data.name: 0209 (402.ja) KYON_SIS (妹)
data.value: Kyon, I'm boooored.

data.name: 0210 (402.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Yeah yeah, we'll be finished soon, so just wait a little longer.

data.name: 0211 (402.ja) KYON_SIS (妹)
data.value: Okayyy.
